comments.body: I don't think this should be allowed with commonjs but only with umd?
The output/resolution format of the program doesn't really influence this flag - *whether* you import something from a UMD module is irrelevant to *how* you might import it

Is this a requirement in **this file**? Given the original issue #1078 is sooo convoluted, it may be well worth a bit of write-up how this new feature works. P.S. I have a feeling it may be extremely useful in some scenarios I am involved, but need a more defined behaviour/usage/spec to know for sure.

You're right, the original issue is a lot to absorb, but this “feature” is actually quite simple. All it does is suppress a particular error message. This one:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3277153/56676223-b164f800-6672-11e9-9c9c-a1658c2e914f.png)

The triple slash reference isn't related to this feature at all; it's related to the `@noImplicitReferences` option which is just a configuration for our test harness.

Does that clear things up, or do you have any additional specific questions?

Thanks, all clear.

It's awesome: from complex to trivial in a couple sentences.
